headline: MMMMM... Brownies
description: These brownies with chocolate chips are delicious and easy to make with pantry staples. They might turn out to be the best brownies you've ever had!

video.description: These chocolate brownies from scratch are easy, moist, and delicious.
video.name: MMMMM... Brownies

name: MMMMM... Brownies

recipeInstructions.text: Preheat the oven to 325 degrees F (165 degrees C). Grease an 8-inch square pan.

Combine sugar, butter, and water in a medium saucepan; cook and stir over medium heat until boiling. Remove from heat and stir in chocolate chips until melted and smooth; mix in eggs and vanilla. Combine flour, salt, and baking soda; stir into the chocolate mixture. Spread brownie batter evenly into the prepared pan.
Bake in the preheated oven until top is dry and edges have started to pull away from the sides of the pan, about 20 to 30 minutes. Let cool completely before cutting into squares.

review.reviewBody: I love this recipe--brownies are moist and have the best top ever! I've made one change: I omit the water in Step 3. It makes my chocolate chips seize. I add it after the eggs are incorporated. No problems then.
Added chopped walnuts.
Better flavour than mmmm mmmm brownies but not THE Brownie. Will try Brooke's
It’s been my go-to recipe for years. Disappears when I make it!!!!
The outcome was so amazing, those warm and soft brownies were one of the best.
I love this recipe! Followed it exactly and it came out perfect!

I had never made brownies from scratch, but looked at a couple of recipes and these ones sounded easy enough. I made recipe exactly as directed. I used Giradelli Semisweet Choc Chips. This recipe had just the right amount of sweetness and deliciously chocolatey. My family said I needed to make again.
I've made this several times. It's delicious and easy. Sometimes I use dark chocolate chunks and/or walnuts
Had so much fun making these with the kids lol!!

Delicious ! Not too sweet for me. I have been baking since I was a teenager in the 60’s. I’ve made brownies, brownies brownies ! I leave out the salt and melt the choc chips into a gooey luscious batter before I fill the baking dish and bake 35 minutes. I add walnuts too. You won’t be disappointed.
My first experience making brownies and I truly won't buy store bought brownies anymore. These are so simple and quick to make. My kids loved them. Putting them in my desert rotation!!

Mine turned out pretty good. I think my only problem was that the batter for the normal recipe was too thick for a normal sized pan. It was too high. So, I used a pan that was wider, and it flattened it out. Maybe that is why for people who have batter on the bottom had issues. Also, if you are having a brownie almost like a cake, that means you mixed the batter too much. If you think they are too bland, wait for them to cool off and add chocolate chips for flavor. I also added some nice, cold vanilla ice cream. Not to be mean, but people saying it tasted good means you made it properly. If the brownies are too dry at 25 minutes, well, something went wrong. Usually things that go wrong are not the recipe's fault.

I honestly don’t understand the praise this recipe gets! It’s more like a bland, dry chocolate cake than a brownie. It doesn’t have that crackly, chewy surface or edge that makes a good brownie nor is it fudgy enough. I didn’t think you could make this combination of ingredients taste bad, but they were borderline inedible and definitely the worst brownies I’ve ever had. If you like a proper brownie, DO NOT make these. There are better recipes out there but sadly I’m not allowed to mention them here or my review will not get published.

Not sure what happened, but the center sunk in the dish, and it took about 38 mins to bake at 325ºF. In the future, think I’ll try 350ºF. But they taste exactly how you want a brownie to taste: fudgy, chocolaty, moist, just delicious. And oh-so-easy to make!
So easy, absolutely delicious!!!
best brownie recipe I have made. Came out perfect and company loved them!
Flavor is ok but the baking time at 325 is way off. Took closer to 45 minutes and my oven bakes hot.
Made the recipe according to directions..fabulous. I haven't used mix or a different recipe for years. By far my favorite.

These are literately THE best brownies I have EVER had. They are so easy to make too! The texture is just perfect: gooey and soft! They taste so chocolatey and delicious!! I love these and make them all the time. They're great, and so good with a scoop of vanilla ice cream on top!!

Made recipe exactly as written. The 25 min. bake time was perfect. Brownies tasted very good, but the texture was oddly like cocoa powder. They were more like a flourless chocolate cake than brownies.
Better than boxed and just as easy!

I did cassava flour (Otto's, 86 grams), applesauce + a few drops of stevia in place of sugar + water, and I used blended plantain in place of the egg (1/4 cup for each egg, so 1/2 cup), and then I totally screwed up and thought I didn't have enough chocolate because my minichips take up less space, but later realized weight wise it was perfectly fine. I ended up adding in a tablespoon of butter and 4 of applesauce to make up the difference in the chocolate chips, LOL, and somehow it still came out pretty darned good! It was a bit bouncy, but I think that's probably due to my miscalculation above. After trying two other chocolate chip based brownies recently that seeped butter out and were inedible unless frozen and the butter lakes avoided, I was really happy to have a reliable recipe to use. This was lightly and perfectly sweet for me. I prefer a fudgy browny, so next time I will not mess up the recipe & cook it for 20 minutes, which I think will do the trick. I would probably add cinnamon if my daughter didn't hate it (sigh). I love having a recipe that works with the substitutions I need.

I love this recipe!! I will forever use this for baking brownies! Its delicious 😋 The only problem was that I was expecting rich fudgey brownies but they were just sweet...Honestly I think that that is my fault for using Hershey's chocolate chips. Next time I make these I will use normal one ;)
When I made these they were DELICIOUS and the only thing I did to change the recipe was change the icing, still I had no problems with the dough and it was a perfect breakfast for us!
Very easy to make. Hubby Loved them.
YUMMY BROWNIES
These are the best! Just the recipe I have been searching for!!

Gets extra points for being so easy, not a lot of ingredients- and most would be in the pantry too. One pot - easy, low mess and easy cleanup. The brownies are very moist & chewy. I added a tsp of instant espresso granules as I like how it pumps up the chocolate flavor. They are crumbly so messy to eat, and if you like thick, cake-like brownies you will be disappointed. Overall, I liked them for the ease and limited ingredients (and not as much sugar as usual), and they will satisfy your chocolate craving!
Super easy to make! I substituted in dark chocolate for semi-sweet morsels. I also added two tablespoons of amaretto! They were delicious!
It was really good!

I thought these were pretty sweet, but good. I doubled the recipe in a 9x13, and it was done after 35 minutes. They are definitely better after they are completely cooled, rather than still hot or warm out of the pan. Saving this recipe to use again!
Fantastic! Wouldn’t change a thing. So easy and delicious.

The flavor was really good on these, but there is hardly any liquid in the recipe, so the consitency was REALLY dry. I'll try to make these again, but will add some cooking oil and see if that will make them more moist.
Easy and delicious
Better than store bought, and so easy to make.
I used chopped Belgian truffles instead of chocolate chips and a teaspoon of chili powder in these, DEFINITELY making these again !!!
I make it all the time. It’s easy and very good
It was very good... I Loved Making It

I followed the recipe. When I added the chips, the pot was so hot it cooked the chocolate and it lost its luster. I let the chocolate mix cool before adding the eggs and vanilla and then the dry part. Brownies came out all right but were cake-like and not fudge like enough in consistency. I think melting the chocolate slowly in a double boiler would be better and use a full stick of room temp butter, which should be creamed with the sugar before combining the rest of the ingredients. These short cuts don't work well.
This is cake like rather than brownie.

I double this recipe using high grade cooking chocolate and these are by far the best brownies ive ever made! I was getting so frustrated not being able to get the right texture and honestly developed bad feelings toward making brownies. THANK YOU!
Just amazing.

Best brownies ever!! The only changes I made were that I used very strong coffee instead of water and I added chocolate chips to the mix right before I poured it into the pan. These turned out so fudgy but still light and fluffy.
This was amazing

Sorry there is no pictures because we ate the entire batch!! Not very healthy of us but these were SOOOoooooo goodddd!! I will never buy box brownies again. This recipe came together in 10 minutes and cooked in 23. I was scared about scrambling the eggs in the chocolate but it all worked. Delicious!!

This was a fabulous recipe! Made this with my 8 year old grand daughter and she really did it all. Perfect brownie taste. You really need to let them set in the pan for a good three hours before you cut them and eat them. I used a cup of semi sweet chocolate morsels and 1/2 cup of milk chocolate. We loved it!
Freaking amazing and so easy!
Best brownies!!
If you are looking for a chewy, gooey brownie recipe this one is for you! I make it as directed and have NEVER been disappointed. These are quite sinful and hard to resist!!!

Easy & delish. It's a little dry and hard to stir before you add the eggs/vanilla & then dry ingredients. But the consistency is fine after you stir a while. I added walnuts which is even better. Will make again!
Seriously delicious! Followed the recipe exactly and ended up with rich, dense, chocolate yummyness. Husband and I had to use self restraint to not eat the whole thing in one day. Highly recommend!
Very good and easy to make.
These were amazing. Ate them right out of the oven with vanilla ice cream on top. Oh my goodness!
They were delicious!
Really good- I scaled the recipe back to just 8/ using one egg. Turned out perfect. My fam loved them.

Always a big hit. My husbear loves them, my work loves them, his work loves them. It's great! These are so versatile. You can really add anything you want to them. I added caramel, walnuts, and even white chocolate to some and they turned out fantastic!

I, too, thought the Brownies were delicious and so easy to make that mixes will no longer be considered. My only question is: how do you keep the chocolate from seizing when you add it to the melted butter, sugar and water?
Love it so much and totally recommend
These are the best brownies ever! So easy and they turn out perfectly every time. They are a big hit with the whole family.
We followed the recipe and the brownies turned out just wonderful! Chewy, chocolatey brownies! Delicious.

These were perfect. I was concerned about adding the eggs to the hot ingredients, because that can sometimes result in bits of scrambled egg in baked goods, but no need to worry, as the results were perfect. If your wet mixture clumps up after stirring in the chocolate chips, just stir well after adding the eggs and vanilla. The brownies are just the way I like them—slightly crisp on the outside and deliciously gooey on the inside. So good!
Great brownies!! The consistency was a little iffy, but other than that loved it!!
My daughter and I made these to take to a barbecue but we ended up stopping on the way and buying something else because we didn’t want to waste these on the people at the barbecue.
25 minutes. Added nuts before cooking. Perfect!!
Loved it! I put some chocolate ganache on top.
Recipe was very easy. Couldn’t go wrong didn’t make any changes.

I am reviewing this recipe as is because that is how it should be! This is absolutely delicious and super easy to make. I made it last minute because I didn't have a brownie mix I thought I had bought, so I was in a bind. That being said, not sure I'd buy a mix again! This surpassed expectations!! Fudgy and chewy and yummy! Now - I would say, you could probably reduce the sugar if that's a thing for you and it would still be plenty sweet enough. I will try to reduce by 1/8 cup next time (every little bit helps!). I also think I will try Andes mints in there, because I think that would also be delicious!!
Very moist! I was out of baking soda and subbed it for baking powder and it still turned out well. I would recommend using salted butter to cut the sweetness, or topping with sea salt.
Soooooo good

This recipe was super simple. I doubled it and I moved the chocolate dough to the mixer before adding the rest of the ingredients. I used a 9x13 pan and baked until ready about 25-28 min. My family loved them
I used butter instead of oil. Otherwise perfect, the best I've had.
This was absolutely amazing! they were gooey and chocolatey on the inside and they stayed that way for days afterwards. A quality recipe, I think this is the only one for me now.
My daughters absolute favourite!!

These are by far the best brownies I’ve ever had any time I mention brownies my family begs me to make them one tip though, make sure you let the water butter sugar mixture sit and cool before adding the eggs because the eggs will cook and it will become chunky. This is very easy to make and this is coming from a ten year old, this is easy! If you don’t have cooking spray just use butter

"As is" the eggs when added to the hot mixture turned into scrambled eggs. Had to start over. Questioned it, knew better, but went with it anyway. Oh well. LOL Mixed in eggs and vanilla after adding flour, etc. the next time with no problem. A bit too sweet so next time around I cut back on sugar and used only 1/8 tsp salt ... perfect! Going to try it next time using dark chocolate -- will just shave some off confectioners block.
Very good. I only had one cup of semi sweet chocolate chips so I used a half cup of white chocolate chips. Came out great! Will definitely make again.
Perfection, easy, wouldn't change a thing!
I don't really like brownies that much and made these for my kids. I couldn't stop eating them. I added chocolate chips to the batter after it cooled as other reviewers suggested. Delicious!
great recipe, no changes needed.
Excellent. It is even easier if you microwave the sugar, water, and butter for 2 1/2 minutes and follow the rest of the instructions.
I never realized it was so easy!

My husband was craving something chocolate, but I was nearly out of cocoa. Since I had two bags of chocolate chips, I searched for brownies made using melted chocolate chips and found this - they were excellent!!! I added 1/4 tsp baking powder as one reviewer suggested, and I ended up baking for the full 30 minutes (turned the heat down by 25 degrees after checking at 25 minutes). They turned out thick and perfectly dense - rose beautifully and did not sink.

Ten minutes out of the oven and oh, yeah! These are amazing. I prepared according to the recipe and wouldn't change a thing. Very chocolatey and moist. Semi-sweet means what it says. Perfect. I baked in convection oven at 325 for 18 minutes.

No substitutions, and these turned out great! I have tried countless brownie recipes. I think adding more chocolate chips right before baking would be a good call, or possibly stirring in some chocolate syrup just to up the chocolate game a bit!
THIS WAS SO STRESSFUL BUT IT CAME OUT BEUTIFUL IN THE END THANK YOU!!!

Trying to cut down on sugar so used monk fruit with erythritol in place of the sugar, still very sweet so next time will reduce the amount. Still very good. Backed 25 minute and they came out more like cake on the edges and kind of runny in the center but maybe when cooled completely will be better.
it was delish! the perfect amount of chocolate. MMMM.... brownies! ( is you said this was too chocolatey- shame on you...)
Mmmmmm

Indeed the best brownies I've ever eaten. I followed the recipe exactly and they weren't too sweet at all. The chocolate chips provided a deep rich flavor. Even my family members who never eat brownies tried them and LOVED them. Great recipe! Thanks!!
It was an easy, simple, and tasty recipe. The brownies turned out amazing afterward.

WARNING: DO NOT MAKE THIS RECIPE!! This is the worst recipe I have ever made! 

I thought this was going to be really good, but it is VERY gross. I did EXACTLY what the recipe called for, I didn't change anything about it. At first, it was really smooth, but then when I tried to put it in the pan, it went crumply. I had no clue how it went from smooth to crumbly! Then, I said, "oh well it will probably be fine after it cooks and maybe it will spread." It didn't, now, that really made me mad. I at least had hope that it would taste okay, but guess what, IT DIDN'T. It was bland and hard. When I tried to chew it was the hardest thing I have ever made. In fact, I only cooked it for 25 minutes. It said that you can cook it for 25-30 minutes. 

I just CANNOT BELIEVE how utterly gross this recipe was. I have made brownies better with the boxed stuff.

I would have taken a picture but my fiancé and his best friend ate the entire pan and I didn’t even add the frosting. I baked mine in the oven for 20mins. If baked any longer than that it burns or gets over baked on the edges. Let cool all the way and it has a similar taste to *two bite brownies*. I agree with others comments as to not over mix the batter, I add chopped up walnuts to the mix for an extra flavour. Thank you for such a wonderful recipe it’s great!

Loved these brownies! I have been making the Best Brownies recipe for years. Decided to give this one a try and it is my new favorite. They were chewy, perfectly chocolately, and had that nice shiny flaky top. I went with nearly as much salt as in the recipes, baked them in a glass 8 x 8 pan, for just a little under the 30 min. Perfect!

I am a 16-year old girl who is an amateur baker when it comes to making things from scratch. I’ve made a few things and they’ve all come out okay, but I had a craving for brownies and had no mix. I found this recipe, was able to find all the ingredients in my house, and made it with no trouble. The end result was so good! My brownies taste really amazing :) So if I can do it, you can do it, too, and it will taste awesome!
It turned out like an inward hill. It looked fine at first when I poured it in the pan, but then when I took it out and tried it when it was cool, it was doughy and tasted meh.
These were excellent, but I did make a couple of changes. I used 2 tablespoons ?of strong coffee instead of water and I added an equal amount of baking powder with the baking soda.
This is about as easy as adding eggs and oil and water to a box mix. It is easy and delicious!
Very easy and delicious recipe! Family ate more than half the pan the minute it came out of the oven!
